region_description: Stonehenge is a prehistoric monument located in Wiltshire, England, and is one of the most famous landmarks in the UK. Dating back to around 2500 BC, this enigmatic stone circle is believed to have been used for ceremonial purposes and astronomical observations. The purpose of its construction remains a mystery, captivating visitors and scholars alike for centuries. Surrounding the site are ancient burial mounds and earthworks, adding to the rich historical context. Visitors can explore the visitor center, view the stones up close, and gain insight into the theories surrounding this ancient site.
